verses.roman:
atho munir yadu-patinā sabhājitaḥ
praṇamya taṁ hṛdi vidadhad vihāyasā
niśamya tad-vyavasitam āhṛtārhaṇo
mukunda-sandaraśana-nirvṛtendriyaḥ

synonyms: atha u—and then; muniḥ—the sage (Nārada); yadu-patinā—by Kṛṣṇa, the Lord of the Yadus; sabhājitaḥ—honored; praṇamya—bowing down; tam—to Him; hṛdi—in his heart; vidadhat—placing Him; vihāyasā—through the sky; niśamya—having heard; tat—His; vyavasitam—affirmed intention; āhṛta—having accepted; arhaṇaḥ—worship; mukunda—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; sandaraśana—by the meeting; nirvṛta—peaceful; indriyaḥ—whose senses.
translation: Honored by Śrī Kṛṣṇa, the chief of the Yadus, Nārada Muni bowed down to the Lord. All of Nārada's senses were satisfied by his meeting with Lord Kṛṣṇa. Thus, having heard the decision of the Lord and having been worshiped by Him, Nārada placed Him firmly within his heart and departed through the sky.
